The Michigan Powerlifting State Championships were hosted by Plainwell High School
time defending National High School Champions
column2: Plainwell Powerlifting Team. Almost 80 lifters competed

column1: with ages ranging from 11 to over 75. More than 70 State records were broken and 10 new American records
were established. Sisters Kendra and Caitlin Miller made their debuts in impressive fashion. Kendra (age 11)

column2: benched 121 and deadlifted 225. Caitlin (13) broke 3 State records that have stood for

column1: more than 17 years for the 97 lb Open class
column3: bencing 143 and deadlifting 270 for a total of

column1: 683 lbs. Other women's highlights include Carly Nogle setting 4 American records for 17 year olds in the
123 class and also winning "Lifter of the Meet" with more than a 900 lbs total. Bonica Brown from Climax
established 4 new American records for 15 year olds in the 198 class.Joining Carly in the Outstanding
Lifter award was Kendra Miller for Youth/Teen/Junior Girls
column2: and Barb Zintsmaster showed once again she is

column1: the best female Master lifter in the state.

column2: 17 year old Vinnie Niedoliwka set 3 new State records in the 148 lb Open class. Only 17

showed age is not a factor at 75 and 68. Ben had an impressive 220 deadlift while Ron set an American
record for the 181 class on his opening pull
column2: then bested that by deadlifting 501 lbs. Josh Decker
